text: The voiceless glottal fricative is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨h⟩`. The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by the "h" in hear and have. == Features == ==Examples== Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe Shapsug /khyg' 'now' Albanian 'the graces' Arabic Modern Standard /haa'il 'enormous' Assyrian Eastern ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ hèmanūta 'faith' Western ܗܪܟܗ harcë 'here' Armenian Eastern /hayeren 'Armenian' Asturian South- central dialects ḥuerza 'force' Oriental dialects ḥacer [haˈθeɾ] "to do" Avar 'oath' Azeri hin 'chicken coop' Basque North-Eastern dialects 'three' Bengali /haoua 'wind' Berber 'shoe' Cantabrian muḥer [muˈheɾ] 'woman' Catalan 'ha!' Chechen / 'this' Chinese Cantonese / 'sea' Taiwanese Mandarin / 'sea' Danish Danish 'house' English high 'high' Esperanto 'home' Eastern Lombard Val Camonica 'Brescia' Estonian 'tooth' Faroese 'she' Finnish 'tooth' French Belgian 'pannier' Galician Occidental, central, and some oriental dialects gato [ˈhätʊ] 'cat' Georgian /hava 'climate' German 'hatred' Greek Cypriot /mahazi 'shop' Hawaiian 'shelf' Hebrew /har 'mountain' Hindi Standard /ham 'we' Hmong 'to honor' Hungarian 'right' Irish shroich 'reached' Italian Tuscan 'the captains' Japanese / 'bare skin' Javanese Javanese ꦩꦲ/Maha The expert, Almighty one Kabardian / tkhyl"khė 'books' Khmer / / 'spicy' 'old' Korean / 'day' Lakota 'voice' Lao /haa 'five' Leonese 'boy' Lezgian /g'ek 'glue' Limburgish Some dialects 'glove' Luxembourgish 'here' Malay 'day' Mutsun 'dog' Navajo 'mister' Norwegian 'hat' Pashto /ho 'yes' Persian /haft 'seven' Pirahã 'he' Portuguese Many Brazilian dialects 'sledgehammer' Most dialects 'Honda' Minas Gerais (mountain dialect) 'art' Colloquial Brazilian Pará Federal University – The pronunciation of /s/ and its variations across Bragança municipality's Portuguese Rio de Janeiro Federal University – The variation of post-vocallic /S/ in the speech of Petrópolis, Itaperuna and Paraty 'drizzle' Romanian 'bridle' Scottish Gaelic 'topsail' Serbo-Croatian Croatian 'hops' Spanish Andalusian and Extremaduran Spanish 'fig' Many dialects 'bishop' Some dialects 'pony' Swedish 'hat' Sylheti /hamukh 'snail' Thai /haa 'five' Turkish 'carpet' Ubykh дуаха [dwaha] 'prayer' Ukrainian 'claws' Urdu Standard /ham 'we' Vietnamese 'understand' Welsh 'sun' West Frisian 'corner' Yi / 'hundred' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiceless glottal fricative
